question: I have been living with trigeminal neuralgia since I was diagnosed in 1998.  Before that I was just living in a great deal of pain with no name.  The trigeminal neuralgia is pretty much been managed by Topamax.  However, I have been experiencing symptoms similar in intensity and frequency in my feet and legs.  It started in my right foot only, about a year ago then gradually the symptoms radiated and grew to include first my left foot, then my right lower leg up to about mid-calf, then left lower leg up to mid-calf and about a month and a half ago it started to be both feet and both my legs up to my knees.  I have been tested for diabetes twice and been given negative diagnosis for diabetes.  The frequency of the pain is several times a day and at such intermittent times that I cannot even begin to think of what might be triggering it externally, if anything.  Any thoughts as to what might be going on for me.  My average bp is 142/88.   My average resting pulse is around 90-ish.  I smoked for sixteen years and quit cold turkey, been almost two and a half years now.  I'm a sober alcoholic now for almost five years.
title: Symptoms in addition to my TN
